translated: The Paṭṭhāna🔽The Dhamma Section in Direct and Reverse Order, the Triad Section of the Paṭṭhāna

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.54. Kilesadukādi, Sanidassanattika🔽Nokilesaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nokileso sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  kilesa duka ādi sa ni dassana ttika  no kilesam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no kilesaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: The defilements, the triad of the visible, etc.🔽With the visible, the impingent, the non-defiled, as condition, the visible, the impingent, the non-defiled, arises, as root-cause condition. (In brief.)🔽With root-cause as condition, three; with predominance as condition, three; … with kamma as condition, one; … with nutriment as condition, three; … with faculty as condition, three; … with absorption as condition, three; … with path as condition, three; … with fruition as condition, three; … with ignorance as condition, three; … with craving as condition, three; … with clinging as condition, three; … with becoming as condition, three; … with birth as condition, three; … with aging-and-death as condition, three.🔽With the non-defiled, the non-impingent, the impingent, as condition, the non-defiled, the non-impingent, arises, as root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root-cause as condition, three; with predominance as condition, three; … with kamma as condition, one; … with nutriment as condition, three; … with faculty as condition, three; … with absorption as condition, three; … with path as condition, three; … with fruition as condition, three; … with ignorance as condition, three; … with craving as condition, three; … with clinging as condition, three; … with becoming as condition, three; … with birth as condition, three; … with aging-and-death as condition, three.
